Standard Routes.Route Name: Sunset Ridge Trail via Long Trail

mount-mansfield.View Type: 360° summit with expansive views over Lake Champlain and the Green Mountains.
mount-mansfield.Best Seasons to Hike: Late spring through fall; avoid icy conditions in winter.
mount-mansfield.Exposure Level: High – upper slopes and ridges are above treeline and subject to strong winds.
mount-mansfield.Terrain Character: Forest climbs transitioning to open krummholz and alpine tundra on the summit ridge.
mount-mansfield.Scramble Sections: Steep, rocky sections in places but no technical climbing.
mount-mansfield.Water Availability: Small brooks near trailheads; no reliable water higher up.
mount-mansfield.Cell Reception Quality: Spotty; limited on some parts of the trail.
mount-mansfield.Nearby Notable Features: Long Trail traverse, ski resorts and iconic alpine summits.
mount-mansfield.Weather Exposure Rating: High – be prepared for rapid weather changes and cold winds on exposed ridges.
mount-mansfield.Emergency Bailout Options: Return via the ascent route; some trails connect to the Long Trail for longer loops.
mount-mansfield.Parking Notes: Fee parking; fills quickly on weekends
mount-mansfield.Dog Friendly: Yes – experienced trail dogs will handle rocky sections; keep leashed on exposed ridges.
mount-mansfield.Summit Marker Type: Rock cairn and/or sign at the summit.
mount-mansfield.Flora/Environment Zones: Mixed hardwood forests at lower elevations, spruce–fir forests, krummholz and alpine tundra near the summit.
